business.headline: Want safe returns? This post office scheme can earn you up to Rs 2 lakh in interestSafe investments often mean modest returns, but that is not always the case. With the right amount and tenure, some secure schemes can generate meaningful interest over time.

8th Pay Commission: What next pay hike may look like for government employeesThe 8th Pay Commission signals higher pay, but history suggests patience may be required before revised salaries and arrears actually reach employees.

First women-led FTA: 3 specialities of India's free trade deal with New ZealandNegotiations for the India–New Zealand Free Trade Agreement were formally launched on March 16, 2025, during discussions between Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal and New Zealand's Trade and Investment Minister Todd McClay.

Waiting for your income tax refund? Why you may not get interest despite the delayWaiting for an income tax refund can be frustrating, especially when the money is stuck for weeks. While the law promises interest on delayed refunds, not every taxpayer is entitled to it.

India, New Zealand sign free trade deal to focus on innovation, investmentThe agreement, described by both sides as ambitious and mutually beneficial, is expected to enhance market access, promote investment flows, strengthen strategic cooperation, and create new opportunities for businesses, farmers, MSMEs, innovators, students and youth across sectors.

Gold hits record high again. Should you buy at these levels?In the domestic market, MCX gold futures are consolidating near lifetime highs around Rs 1,35,400 per 10 grams. Prices continue to hold a rising channel, suggesting strong underlying demand.

Explained: Why Groww share price gained 6% todayGroww share price: The rally in the stock comes after a strong move last week as well. Groww shares had already risen about 13% on Friday, and Monday marked the third straight session of gains for the stock.

Shriram Finance share price jumps 4% today. Here's why it's gainingThe stock moved higher after global brokerage MUFG raised its target price on Shriram Finance, citing the strong strategic impact of its recent deal and the potential for a re-rating.

Infosys shares rise 3% today. Why is the IT giant's stock price rising?Shares in the Bengaluru-based software services firm were up 2.18% on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 10:10 am to trade at Rs 1,674.50, reflecting stronger sentiment after the company addressed market speculation linked to sharp ADR moves last week.

Foxconn's new women-led iPhone plant in India hires 30,000 staff: ReportThe workers receive free accommodation, subsidised meals, and earn an average salary of around Rs 18,000 per month, among the highest for women in blue-collar manufacturing roles.
Sensex jumps over 500 points: Why is stock market rising today?The Sensex was trading at 85,434.75, up 505.39 points at 9:31 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 166.50 points to 26,132.90.
Sensex opens 372 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Infosys jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 491.74 points to 85,421.10, while the NSE Nifty50 added 157.75 points to 26,124.15 as of 9:29 am.

Gold surges to record high: Why is it rising again?Gold, which is seen as a safe store of value during uncertain times, has risen 67% so far this year. While gold touched new highs, silver prices moved in the opposite direction in the domestic market.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market continue to fall or open higher?Gift Nifty futures were trading at around 26,190 points at 7:52 am IST, pointing to a positive start for the Nifty, compared with Friday's close of 25,966.4. This suggests markets may try to recover after a weak spell.

India in goldilocks phase with 8% growth, low inflation: RBI GovernorIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Sanjay Malhotra described the Indian economy as being in a 'Goldilocks period' characterised by high GDP growth of 8 per cent and low inflation.

India is flying more, but why do airlines still struggleIndia's skies are busier than ever, airports are expanding, and passengers are flying in record numbers. Yet the business of running an airline remains unforgiving.

New insurance rules: Will claim settlements improve for policyholders?The new insurance laws strengthen oversight and enforcement. In this special report, IndiaToday.in examines whether that will actually improve claim settlements for policyholders.
Silver slips after hitting record high of Rs 2.04 lakh/kg in Delhi, gold flatSpot silver was trading 0.56 per cent higher at USD 65.85 per ounce in the overseas trade.

From ports to airports: What pushed Adani Group into aviationJeet Adani, Gautam Adani's younger son and a director at Adani Airports, said the experience gained in ports and logistics helped the group enter aviation with confidence.

Why Jeet Adani says resilience is the next big challenge for Indian aviationWhile speaking to India Today, Adani said that aviation is a fragile system in which even small issues can quickly escalate into major problems.

entertainment.headline: Weathering With You proves anime romances are never just about love In this week's Animania, we discuss Weathering With You, a visually stunning anime that blends romance, rain and rebellion. The film explores love, climate anxiety and growing up in modern Tokyo.

Shiva Rajkumar on cancer recovery: Didn't know if I'd hold my wife's hand again At a press event for the film 45 in Chennai, Shiva Rajkumar discussed his recovery from cancer surgery, the impact of his brother Puneeth's death, his film collaborations, political intentions, and his upcoming role in a female avatar.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Sudeep reveals twist as wildcards Rajath-Chaitra exit Bigg Boss Season 11 contestants Rajath and Chaitra, who entered the Season 12 house first as guests and later as wildcard contestants, exited the show after Kiccha Sudeep made a surprising revelation.

Shilpa Shetty shares memories of father Surendra on his 85th birth anniversary Shilpa Shetty remembered her late father Surendra Shetty on what would have been his 85th birthday, sharing emotional family moments and a heartfelt note on social media.

No veneer, whitewashing: Priyanka Chaturvedi endorses Dhurandhar as new age cinema Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi reviewed Dhurandhar and called it fearless new-age cinema. She compared Aditya Dhar's film with Chhaava -- both featuring Akshaye Khanna.

Ajay Devgn's Drishyam 3 release date out: Aakhri hissa baaki hai, watch promo The makers of Drishyam 3 have announced the film's release date. Starring Ajay Devgn, Tabu, Shriya Saran, and Rajat Kapoor, shooting of the film is underway across multiple cities.

Big B remembers mother Teji Bachchan on 18th death anniversary: Din samarpit Amitabh Bachchan remembered his late mother Teji Bachchan on her 18th death anniversary with an emotional blog post, saying there were no words left, only prayers.

Did Prabhas' The Raja Saab land the highest non-theatrical deal? Producer clarifies Amid speculation around The Raja Saab's non-theatrical business, the producer has said that the upcoming film has secured the highest value available.

Arjun Rampal plays Dhurandhar's FA9LA at Gurugram club, turns DJ as crowd goes wild Arjun Rampal played a remix of FA9LA from the film Dhurandhar during a DJ set at a Gurugram club, drawing cheers from the crowd. The video instantly went viral. Watch it inside.

Elton John and David Furnish mark 20 years of love and marriage Singer Elton John and David Furnish commemorated their 20th anniversary as civil partners and 11th wedding anniversary on December 21, 2025, sharing messages and memories on social media reflecting on their relationship's milestones.

Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi on anti-Hindi protests? Promo hints at 1965 incident A new exhibition and promo for Sivakarthikeyan's upcoming film Parasakthi have sparked discussions about the possibility of a biopic, following the actor's previous work in Amaran. The film, directed by Sudha Kongara, will hit theatres during Pongal.
Badshah hands over new homes to Punjab flood victims Rapper Badshah, together with Sikh Aid Foundation, has handed over newly constructed houses to families affected by catastrophic floods in Punjab.

Mahhi Vij wins praise for TV comeback in Seher, husband Jay Bhanushali cheers her Mahhi Vij has won hearts with her powerful comeback on television through Seher Hone Ko Hai, earning praise from fans for her role as a fearless mother.

Avatar Fire & Ash box office Day 3: Cameron's film eclipsed by Dhurandhar in India Avatar: Fire & Ash opened to Rs 66.65 crore in India, but James Cameron's biggie struggled as Dhurandhar stormed past Rs 550 crore. Check a detailed breakdown inside.

Mukesh Khanna said no to Ranveer Singh for Shaktiman role, now he's praising him Veteran actor Mukesh Khanna describes Ranveer Singh's role in Dhurandhar as outstanding and calls the film a perfect commercial success, even after previously denying Singh the role of Shaktimaan.

Jon Hamm's viral sway fuels meme trend and series buzz. All you need to know A clip of Jon Hamm swaying to the Kato and Jon remix of 'Turn the Lights Off' has exploded into a viral meme. The meme's rapid rise has drawn surprise and grateful reactions from DJ Kato. Here's all you need to know about the clip and the show associated with it.

Madhuri Dixit: I am not scared of de-glam roles, comfortable in my skin Madhuri Dixit reveals she is not scared of taking on de-glam roles and prioritises honesty to the character. Her new series Mrs Deshpande streams on JioHotstar, marking a shift towards gritty storytelling in her career.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: FJ, Aadhirai evicted, host tells Sandra to cut the drama The weekend episodes of Bigg Boss Tamil Season 9 featured double eliminations and emotional moments, with Aadhirai and FJ leaving the house and the prized family visit privilege shifting to VJ Parvathy.

The Great Flood review: When spectacle drowns substanceRelease Date:Fri Dec 19, 2025 The Great Flood presents a gripping survival story set against record floods in Seoul. However, its shift into unclear sci-fi elements weakens the emotional impact and narrative focus.

general news.headline: Bangladesh student leader shot in head during violent protests over Hadi's killingThe shooting of NCP labour leader Md Motaleb Sikder follows the killing of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, whose death sparked protests and heightened concerns over Bangladesh's law and order.

Decoded: The Aravalli Hills controversy and what's at stakeThe Supreme Court introduced a new height-based definition for the Aravalli Hills, triggering widespread concern about ecological risks. Environmentalists and opposition leaders warn this may lead to increased mining and irreversible damage to the region's fragile ecosystem.

Bangladesh lynching shocker: Hindu man's co-workers joined Islamist mob to kill himJust a timely call could have saved the life of 27-year-old Hindu man Dipu Chandra Das, who was lynched by Islamists in Bangladesh. Investigators and reports have revealed that Das was forced to resign by his factory colleagues and handed over to the mob that broke into the factory to drag him out. He was brutally beaten to death and his body was set on fire.

We felt it: Asim Munir claims 'divine help' during Op Sindoor, warns TalibanWhile addressing the National Ulema Conference in Islamabad, Asim Munir claimed "divine help" during Operation Sindoor and urged Afghanistan's Taliban to choose between backing the TTP or maintaining ties with Islamabad.

Why is Saudi Arabia witnessing rare snowfall? Science explainedThe unusual episode once again underlined how climate change is harbouring unusual weather in regions that are far from prepared to handle it.

Sorry Mummy, Papa: Engineering student dies by suicide, cites exam stress in notePolice said a suicide note recovered from the room states that the student felt she could not meet her parents' expectations and was distressed about her academic performance and financial burden on the family.

Dhurandhar box office day 17: Ranveer beats Ranbir's Animal, enters all-time top 10'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has entered the all-time top 10 Indian films and crossed the box office collection of Ranbir Kapoor's film 'Animal'. Its robust box office performance is despite facing competition from major releases such as 'Avatar: Fire & Ash'.

A snub that stings: What Shubman Gill can learn from Rohit SharmaSeen as India's future across formats as recently as a few months ago, Shubman Gill now faces a rare pause. His T20 World Cup omission hurts, but history suggests setbacks shape leaders more than seamless ascents ever do.

Hidden world of Cholanaikkans, isolated Kerala tribe that lives by sunlightEntry into their habitat is restricted, and interactions with the outside world are carefully mediated by government authorities to protect a fragile culture that could be irreversibly altered by sustained contact.

Air India Delhi-Mumbai flight turns back after engine oil pressure drops to zeroAn Air India flight from Delhi to Mumbai returned shortly after take-off due to a critical engine oil pressure drop, ensuring passenger safety through prompt action.

No degree, no scholarship, yet Srinivasa Ramanujan changed mathematics foreverSrinivasa Ramanujan failed formal exams but revolutionised mathematics through self-study. His legacy challenges rigid education systems and inspires India annually on National Mathematics Day.

First women-led FTA: 3 specialities of India's free trade deal with New ZealandNegotiations for the India–New Zealand Free Trade Agreement were formally launched on March 16, 2025, during discussions between Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal and New Zealand's Trade and Investment Minister Todd McClay.

No workout, no crash diets: How discipline helped me lose 21 kilos in 10 monthsI didn't wait for a Monday or a New Year's resolution. I started anyway and lost 21 kilos in 10 months. Here's what worked for me and might help you too.

Sarod maestro hides Indian identity, flees Dhaka after Islamist attack at ChhayanautSarod maestro Shiraz Ali Khan was forced to flee from Dhaka, concealing his Indian identity for safety, amid an arson attack on the Bangla cultural institution, Chhayanaut, where he was set to perform. The incident highlights the increasing threats to artists and Bangla cultural heritage under the Muhammad Yunus regime, where Islamists are holding sway.

This isn't India: New Zealand far-right group performs Haka against SikhsA Sikh religious procession in Auckland had to pause when a far-right group blocked it with a Haka display. The Sikhs, including Nihangs, did not react to the protests. Community leaders have expressed concern, noting this was the third big anti-immigrant incident in New Zealand this year.

US Justice Department restores Trump photo in Epstein files after backlashThe Justice Department briefly removed and then restored a photograph featuring President Donald Trump from the Jeffrey Epstein investigative files, sparking political debate in the US. The removal was due to concerns about victim privacy, not the president himself, according to officials.

The meme's rapid rise has drawn surprise and grateful reactions from DJ Kato. Here's all you need to know about the clip and the show associated with it.

The day I blast…: Surya's speech on poor form at Ahmedabad university goes viralBacked despite lean returns, Suryakumar Yadav reiterated his acknowledgement of a dip in T20I form in 2025. The India captain will be under pressure as he prepares the team for the T20 World Cup, starting February 7.

Tata Harrier, Safari petrol review: Tata's flagship SUVs now with gasoline engineTata has finally given the Harrier and Safari what many buyers wanted all along, a petrol engine. With the new Hyperion motor, these flagship SUVs open themselves up to a much wider audience.

This tech company is gifting up to Rs 1.5 crore flats to employees, here is whyA Chinese automotive tech firm is turning heads by rewarding long-serving employees with premium flats worth up to Rs 1.5 crore to secure loyalty and retain skilled talent.

Why is India's Gen Z quietly quitting without resigning?The Gen Z in India is redefining disengagement not by walking out of offices, but by emotionally checking out while remaining on payrolls. Resignations are scanty and this absence is masking a deeper crisis brewing inside workplaces.

Bondi Beach gunmen threw bombs on day of attack, had rehearsed shooting for monthsThe Bondi Beach terror attack was a result of meticulous planning inspired by Islamic State ideology, involving firearms training and reconnaissance. The father-son duo executed a deadly assault on a Jewish event, leaving 15 dead and many injured.

India is a Hindu nation, no constitutional approval needed: Mohan BhagwatRSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasised that India would remain a Hindu nation as long as people celebrate the cultural heritage of the country and the glory of their ancestors.

After Dhurandhar surprise, Jonas brothers' ode to Zeenat Aman, featuring PriyankaNick Jonas and his brothers discovered a new pre-show hype song, and it is a Bollywood classic. This time, Priyanka Chopra, too, joined the Jonas Brothers, as they grooved to the song.

sports.headline: Bazball for nothing? Nasser Hussain questions England branding after Ashes defeat Nasser Hussain reckons that despite the Bazball rebranding, England's showing against Australia in the Ashes has ultimately proved "no different" from past drubbings away from home.

Jacob Duffy shatters Richard Hadlee's 40-year record after series win vs West Indies Jacob Duffy broke Sir Richard Hadlee's 40-year-old record after New Zealand's win over West Indies in the third Test. Duffy took his third five-wicket haul to guide New Zealand to a 323-run victory.

Not Finished: MI Emirates' Shakib Al Hasan sinks Desert Vipers in ILT20 Shakib Al Hasan starred with bat and ball to power MI Emirates to a four-wicket ILT20 win over Desert Vipers, even as the 38-year-old fuels speculation about a final international return for Bangladesh.

Autograph on iPhone: Virat Kohli makes net bowler's day in Alibaug training session A young fast bowler from Jharkhand, who bowled to Virat Kohli during a three-day training session in Alibaug, shared photographs he clicked with the legendary batter. The youngster also posted a picture of his autographed iPhone.

Defiant Broad sticks to 'worst Australian side since 2010' swipe despite Ashes loss Stuart Broad has refused to backtrack on his pre-Ashes assessment, insisting he has "no regrets" about branding this Australia side the worst since 2010 despite England losing all three completed Tests of the five-match series.

Pakistan learning from India? Ex-coach hints at analysing India's success model Pakistan is closely monitoring India's limited-overs cricket success to revive its fortunes. The focus is on grassroots talent and infrastructure ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Manchester United dealt major blow as Bruno Fernandes faces extended injury absence Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes is expected to miss upcoming Premier League fixtures after sustaining a hamstring injury during the defeat to Aston Villa, further compounding the club's injury problems.

I was shocked: Former captain says he didn't expect India to drop Shubman Gill Former India captain Kris Srikkanth said he didn't expect the selectors to drop Shubman Gill from the T20 World Cup squad. The ex-chairman of selectors gave Ajit Agarkar and his selection team credit for valuing domestic performances.

Bazball died in Adelaide: How Australian media covered England's Ashes nightmare Australia completed a dominant Ashes series victory over England with a 3-0 lead in the five-match series. Following their win, the Australian media mocked the England team by giving a twist to the historic Ashes obituary.

NZ vs WI: Jacob Duffy's 5-wicket haul sets up 2-0 series win for NZ with 323-run win New Zealand beat West Indies by 323 runs in the third Test to claim the series 2-0. Jacob Duffy was adjudged Player of the Match for taking his third five-wicket haul.

The day I blast…: Surya's speech on poor form at Ahmedabad university goes viral Backed despite lean returns, Suryakumar Yadav reiterated his acknowledgement of a dip in T20I form in 2025. The India captain will be under pressure as he prepares the team for the T20 World Cup, starting February 7.

New Zealand's Suzie Bates ruled out for three months due to quadriceps injuryNew Zealand opener Suzie Bates will miss the remainder of the domestic season and upcoming White Ferns series due to a quadriceps injury. She is determined to recover in time for the South Africa tour, aiming to return strong despite the setback.

A snub that stings: What Shubman Gill can learn from Rohit SharmaSeen as India's future across formats as recently as a few months ago, Shubman Gill now faces a rare pause. His T20 World Cup omission hurts, but history suggests setbacks shape leaders more than seamless ascents ever do.

England's cockiness cost the Ashes, Australia are laughing at them: VaughanFormer captain Michael Vaughan has strongly criticised England's approach following their another Ashes series loss in Australia. England's defeat in Adelaide, resulting in a 0-3 deficit, has intensified scrutiny over the team's attitude and preparation, with Vaughan calling the outcome 'humbling.'

Vaishnavi Sharma credits captain Harmanpreet after debut heroics vs Sri LankaIND-W vs SL-W: Vaishnavi Sharma impressed on her international debut with a disciplined four-over spell, helping India restrict Sri Lanka to 121/6. Sharma praised captain Harmanpreet Kaur's leadership, highlighting her influence both before and during the match.

With Bazball now pronounced dead, can England afford to sack Brendon McCullum?Australia's demolition of England has exposed the limits of Bazball and left the ECB facing a stark choice: evolve with McCullum, or risk another identity crisis by sacking him.

IND vs SL: Why waste good form? Jemimah Rodrigues making India's No.3 her ownJemimah Rodrigues laid down the marker and proved why she is India's No.3 for the long haul as they defeated Sri Lanka in the first T20I on Sunday, December 21. With the T20 World Cup coming up, the 25-year-old is ready to make the spot her own and be a vital part of the Indian team.

IND vs SL: No World Cup hangover as India thrash Sri Lanka in 1st T20IThe Indian women's team put on a dominant performance to thrash Sri Lanka by eight wickets to start the T20I series with a win in Vizag on Sunday, December 21.

IND vs SL: Smriti Mandhana hits new milestone after return to actionSmriti Mandhana crossed a new milestone as she became the second player in women's T20Is to get to the 4,000-run mark during the first match of the series between India and Sri Lanka.

Rohit Sharma contemplated retirement after 2023 World Cup: Felt I had nothing leftFormer India captain Rohit Sharma revealed that he considered retirement after the loss to Australia in the final of the 2023 World Cup. India stumbled at the final hurdle with the Aussies securing a comfortable win.

Green is the future: Why KKR went big for all-rounder in IPL 2026 auctionKolkata Knight Riders head coach Abhishek Nayar details the strategic acquisition of Australian all-rounder Cameron Green at the IPL 2026 auction, highlighting the franchise's intent to strengthen its top order and fill the gap left by Andre Russell's departure.

Sports must get priority, says Bhaichung Bhutia after Messi's chaotic India tourFormer India football captain Bhaichung Bhutia and national team defender Sandesh Jhingan have spoken out following the disorder at Lionel Messi's Kolkata event, highlighting the need for sport to take precedence over politics at major football occasions.

Who is Vaishnavi Sharma? U19 sensation rewarded with T20I debut in VisakhapatnamIND vs SL, Women's T20Is: India handed a debut to U19 star Vaishnavi Sharma against Sri Lanka, reflecting a bold push to expand depth ahead of the T20 World Cup. The 20-year-old spinner's rise adds fresh promise to the squad.

India snub Naqvi after U19 Asia Cup final, PCB chief joins Pakistan celebrationsIndia snubbed Mohsin Naqvi completely during the U19 Asia Cup final post-match presentation while the PCB chairman decided to hand the trophy to Pakistan and celebrate with them after their win on Sunday, November 21.

Hope for Indian football? Asian Football Confederation set to launch Nations LeagueWith ISL governance in limbo and commercial uncertainty mounting, the AFC Nations League arrives as a rare opportunity for India to secure meaningful fixtures and competitive continuity amid domestic turbulence.

1st T20I Highlights: Jemimah's unbeaten fifty gives India 8-wicket winIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women 1st T20I Highlights: A composed finish from India sees Jemimah Rodrigues and Harmanpreet Kaur steer the chase home, capitalising on Sri Lanka's late misfields. Smart rotation under pressure seals a clinical win and highlights India's poise.

India stunned as Pakistan clinch U19 Asia Cup title with 191-run winPakistan beat India by 191 runs in the final to win their second U19 Asia Cup title. Sameer Minhas scored 172, after which Ali Raza's four-wicket haul helped Pakistan bowl their opponents out for 156 in the final.

Suryavanshi's U19 Asia Cup final flop show: Spat with Ali Raza, slammed by fansVaibhav Suryavanshi had a day to forget in the U19 Asia Cup Final as he had another poor performance with the bat against Pakistan. Suryavanshi then had a spat with Ali Raza and the fans slammed his performance on the day.

NZ vs WI: Conway, Latham create a first in Tests with twin centuriesDevon Conway and Tom Latham set unprecedented records as New Zealand's opening pair, both scoring two centuries each in the same Test against the West Indies at Bay Oval.

Job's done: Pat Cummins opts out of MCG Test, emphasises WTC outcome not a concernPat Cummins is set to miss the Boxing Day Test as Australia, having already retained the Ashes, focus on managing risks despite a dominant World Test Championship run. On Sunday, the Aussies took a 3-0 lead in the series with an 82-run win at the Adelaide Oval.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
